keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
keywords.name: subject

byline.original: By AURELIEN BREEDEN and ALISON SMALE
byline.contributor: Aurelien Breeden reported from Paris, and Alison Smale reported from Cologne.

lead_paragraph: The German police said the man, who approached a Paris police station with fake explosives last week, had lived in a house for migrants in Germany.

headline.print_headline: Man Shot in Paris Remains a Mystery
headline.main: Suspect Shot by Paris Police Tied to German Migrant House

snippet: The German police said the man, who approached a Paris police station with fake explosives last week, had lived in a house for migrants in Germany.
abstract: German authorities provide information on unidentified man who was killed four days earlier by Paris police after he advanced on them with meat cleaver and fake explosives; say suspect lived in Recklinghausen home for asylum seekers since August, had used at least seven different identities, and served jail time.
